name: HATS-1
scenarioDescription:
The HATS-1 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HATS-1 is a star with 0.99 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.04 times its radius. It is located 988.2526799999999 light years away from the solar system.

HATS-1 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HATS-1 system

HATS-1 b

HATS-1 b was discovered by the HATSouth observatory using the Transit method. The mass of HATS-1 b is 589.55 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HATS-1 b is 14.594 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HATS-1 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, HATS-1 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HATS-1, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by HATSouth.
